column4: is it possible to autorun a cd in ubuntu if it has an autorun.inf file?
or is that completely windows specific?
Yes, you just need to set it up in your desktop
What desktop are you using Gnome or KDE?
if I run it it prompts me asking if i want to run it or view it but nothing happens when i run it
In System go to Administration and there should be a setting to enable CD autorun.  I use KDE, so I will have to find it.
it's just opening a html file
it would be nice if i could just run the mounted cd though
Nautilus should show the contents of what is on the cd.  Also, you could try doing ls /media/cdrom in the terminal
oh, i can browse the cd fine, i just meant it would be nice to be able to just autorun it rather than running the file
I guess I misunderstood what you meant.  autorun a program is a windows thing, not linux.
Linux can autorun mp3 cds, movie cds and such, but not say games.
It may mean your /etc/mtab points to a different drive than your /etc/fstab
oh, maybe rightclick>unmount has nothing to do with gmount-iso
